details.title: Speed of sound and ideal-gas heat capacity at constant pressure for HFC-125
details.abstract: The gaseous speed of sound, the ideal-gas heat capacity at constant pressure, and the second Virial coefficient were determined for penta fluoroe thane (HFC-125). A total of 49-da ta points of speed of sound for gaseous HFC-125 were measured for temperatures from 273 to 313 K and pressures from 32 to 479 kPa with a cylindrical, variable-path acoustic interferometer. The ideal-gas heat capacity at constant pressure and the second acoustic Virial coefficient were determined over the temperature range from the speed of sound measurements and were correlated as functions of temperature. An analytical expression for the second Virial coefficient derived using the square-well intennolecular potential model was compared with the data.

keywords: ideal-gas heat capacity at constan pressure
